title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Meet the Palmer Penguins!!


For this analysis we’ll use a few packages for visualization and data display.
themes: https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-themes.html


Code
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns 
from IPython.display import Markdown

sns.set_style('whitegrid')





The dataset we’ll use comes from the palmerpenguins package.


Code
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins

penguins = load_penguins()


This dataset contains size measurements, clutch observations, and blood isotope ratios for 344 adult foraging Adélie, Chinstrap, and Gentoo penguins observed on islands in the Palmer Archipelago near Palmer Station, Antarctica.
Let’s take a peek at the data. The table below shows the first five rows of the penguins data frame.


Code
Markdown(penguins.head().to_markdown(index=False))




Table 1: First five rows of the penguins data frame.

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Body mass vs. flipper length
The figure below the relationship between body mass and flipper length of penguins.


Code
# from https://github.com/mcnakhaee/palmerpenguins
g = sns.lmplot(x="flipper_length_mm",
               y="body_mass_g",
               hue="species",
               height=7,
               data=penguins,
               palette=['#FF8C00','#159090','#A034F0'])
g.set_xlabels('Flipper Length (mm)')
g.set_ylabels('Body Mass (g)')








Figure 1: Body mass vs. flipper length of penguins

title: my website
text:
import pandas as pd


df = pd.read_csv("../../source/se_68795_njt_hilton_garage/data/raw/gwb_timepoints.csv", parse_dates=["EventTime", "DepartureTime"])
data = df.set_index("EventTime").resample("H").count()


import plotly.express as px 
px.line(data["BUS_ID"])

                                                



import keplergl

map = keplergl.KeplerGl()
map.add_data(df[~pd.isnull(df["LATITUDE"])][["LONGITUDE", "LATITUDE"]])
map.save_to_html()

User Guide: https://docs.kepler.gl/docs/keplergl-jupyter
Map saved to keplergl_map.html!
